intro: Acrosynanthus ovatus, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces tiny, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in summer, typically arranged in dense inflorescences. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in xeriscapic gardens.
